learning_outcomes.description: Define, explain and interrelate fundamental concepts of physics, of relevance to biological systems
Identify the essential physics governing the behaviour of a range of systems
Apply theory and techniques to solve a range of numerical problems and obtain correct values for physical quantities in appropriate units of measurement
Investigate phenomena, perform experimental measurements and analyse data
Comprehend and present information in various scientific forms (tabular, graphical, diagrammatic, written)

assessments.due_date: Submission of the practical worksheets will occur in-person at the completion of each Practical Class.
assessments.task_description:
The practicals for PHYS1171 consist of an introductory session followed by assessed laboratory activities.

Students will perform five experiments during semester (E0, E1, E2, E3-I, E3-II) and gather data for analysis, in small groups in labs on-campus.

A worksheet will be completed individually for each of five experiments and submitted by the end of the session.

The first worksheet, E0, is worth 3%. The next three worksheets E1, E2, E3-I, are each worth 6%. The final worksheet is more complex and worth 9%.

The total grade for the Practical Class worksheets is an assessment hurdleâ€”student must achieve at least 40% of the total available 30 marks to pass the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: For each assessed experiment, submit your electronic worksheet via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: For all five assessed experiments, extensions are not available because worksheets are to be submitted by the end of the class session. If you are unable to attend your scheduled practical class, please attend another practical class to complete the assessment. The schedule of practical classes can be found on Blackboard. If you are unable to attend, please email PHYS1171@uq.edu.au to explain your circumstances, including an explanation of why you cannot attend another session. You will need to do this within 5 calendar days of your original practical class and include appropriate evidence (e.g., medical certificate). If approved, you will be given an exemption from that assessment, and your remaining marks will be reweighted. For example, with one exemption your mark will be taken from the 4 assessments completed of the 5 practicals. You can receive at most two exemptions during semester.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date: Submission of the quiz will occur in-person at the completion of each Applied Class.
assessments.task_description: In the final 15 minutes of each Applied Class, students will complete a short quiz to be handed in at the conclusion of the class. Each quiz will be worth 5 marks, with the best 8 out of 11 quizzes to count, for a possible total of 40 marks which will go towards 20% of the final grade.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quizzes will be paper-based and handed in at the conclusion of each Applied Class.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The end-of-semester examination will require short written answers in which you explain concepts and solve problems.

Course material from throughout the semester will be examinable.

A formula sheet along with selected physical constants will be given on the exam paper.

It will be an in-person, invigilated exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
